result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S. Trudeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE or schooling.

Complete any counseling, treatment, assessment as deemed necessary by agent.  Complete anger management program, if not already completed.  

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:58am
INCLUDES 13CF40 & 15CF476
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn 
Date and time set for motion on revoking DEOJ in 13CF40 & plea in 15CF476

13CF40:
State filed motion in July 2015 to revoke DEOJ in 13CF40
State asking court to withdraw DEOJ in order for deft to have time to pay back restitution
COURT grants request to withdraw DEOJ motion to revoke
COURT signs judgement in 13CF40 Ct. 1 Susbstantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm: to pay back restitution to DA office directly, follow probation rules, DEOJ extension until 10/23/17 and follow all conditions of bond. 
COURT grants amending 13CF40 Ct. 1 to misdemeanor battery if deft completes DEOJ successfully

15CF576:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping-Felony to be amended to state Disorderly Conduct
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct-Use of dangerous weapon to dimiss "use of dangerous weapon"
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CF476
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. Probation for 2 years, concurrently.
CONDITIONS: Complete any counseling, treatment, assessment as deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time work or full time school. Complete anger management program, if not already completed. Pay CC and DNA sample plus surcharge. Zero days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 10:16am
